task.title: Buckets Landing Page
task.shortdesc: This screen allows you to view a list of your buckets, create new buckets, and delete buckets. Use the scroll bar to view additional buckets not in the browser's current view.

taskbody.prereq: To access this page from the dashboard, click Buckets from the left navigation bar under STORAGE or click the Buckets icon (bucket symbol) to display the Buckets landing page:

step.cmd: From the dashboard, click Create bucket beneath the Buckets icon.
From the Buckets landing page, click the CREATE BUCKET button near the top of the page.

taskbody.result:
The Create new bucket page opens.
For additional information on completing that page, refer to the instructions provided in its Help content.

task.title: Shared Bucket
task.shortdesc: Shared buckets are in other accounts that you may or may not have access. If you do not have permissions to open a shared bucket, you may still have permissions to download objects from it or upload files to it.

substep.cmd: From the Buckets landing page, click the OPEN SHARED BUCKET button near the top of the page.
substep.stepresult: The Open shared bucket dialog box opens.

substep.cmd: Enter the name of the bucket you want to access in the field provided.
You may optionally choose to save this bucket to your own list of buckets to bookmark it for later, click the check box.
Click OPEN BUCKET to open the bucket.

info.note: If you see a message that you don't have permissions to open the bucket or the bucket you entered does not exist. Check the name again, or contact the owner or administrator of the bucket to grant you permissions to the bucket.

If you chose to save the bucket to your list, the name of the bucket you entered displays on the list, whether or not you were successful gaining access to it. A shared bucket appearing on the list is denoted by a smaller bucket icon with a line under it.

substep.stepresult: If access is allowed, the page for the shared bucket opens with a list of its objects.

step.cmd: To download an object from a shared bucket, you must know the object's full path:

substep.cmd: From the Buckets landing page, click the down arrow next to the OPEN SHARED BUCKET button near the top of the page.

substep.stepresult: The Download object dialog box opens.

substep.cmd: Enter the full path of the object, including the name of the bucket you want to access in the field provided.
Click DOWNLOAD OBJECT to download the object.

info.note: If you get an error message that the object cannot be retrieved, check the names again, or contact the owner or administrator of the bucket to grant you the proper permissions.

substep.stepresult: If access is allowed, the object downloads to your designated folder.

step.cmd: To upload an object to a shared bucket, you must specify a folder in the shared bucket:

substep.cmd: From the Buckets landing page, click the down arrow next to the OPEN SHARED BUCKET button near the top of the page.

substep.stepresult: The Upload object(s) dialog box opens. For additional information on completing that page, refer to the instructions provided in its Help content.

step.cmd: To delete a shared bucket from your Buckets list:

substep.cmd: From the Buckets landing page, locate a shared bucket by its smaller bucket icon with a line under it.
In the Actions column, click the action icon (･･･) for the shared bucket you no longer want to display and select Remove from view.

task.title: View Details of a Bucket
task.shortdesc: The most important detail about a bucket is the objects it contains.

taskbody.context: To view the objects in a bucket from the Buckets landing page:

step.cmd: Click a bucket from the Name column or click a number from the Objects column of the bucket you want to view.
In the Actions column, click the action icon (･･･) for the bucket you want to view and select View contents.
To view details of the bucket itself:

substep.cmd: From the Buckets landing page, click a name in the list of buckets.
In the selected bucket's page, click View details near the top of the page, next to the bucket's name.
From the Buckets landing page, click the action icon (･･･) from the Actions column of the bucket you want to view and select View details.

task.title: Actions
task.shortdesc: Each entry in the Buckets list has a context menu, accessible from the Actions column. Clicking the action icon brings up a menu of actions that you can perform on the selected bucket.

taskbody.context:
The following context menu actions are available:
View contents. Brings up a list of objects associated with selected bucket.
View details. Brings up the detail page for selected bucket.
Delete. Allows you to delete the selected bucket. You cannot delete a bucket unless it is empty. To delete a bucket, you must first delete all the folders and files the bucket contains.
